text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/3482be6a33c3a00fe1e8e604310ad3034f593045|patch 8.2.2058: using mkview/loadview changes the jumplist>
patch 8.2.2058: using mkview/loadview changes the jumplist

Problem:    Using mkview/loadview changes the jumplist.
Solution:   Use ":keepjumps".  Don't let ":badd" or ":balt" change the
            jumplist. (closes #7371)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2058: using mkview/loadview changes the jumplist · vim/vim@3482be6
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2058: using mkview/loadview changes the jumplist · vim/vim@3482be6
attachments.text: Problem: Using mkview/loadview changes the jumplist. Solution: Use ":keepjumps". Don't let ":badd" or ":balt" change the jumplist. (closes #7371)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/fccbf068f8c85474db8d8dead1530321d1f3e5b8|patch 8.2.2057: getting the selection may trigger TextYankPost autocmd>
patch 8.2.2057: getting the selection may trigger TextYankPost autocmd

Problem:    Getting the selection may trigger TextYankPost autocmd.
Solution:   Only trigger the autocommand when yanking in Vim, not for getting
            the selection. (closes #7367)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2057: getting the selection may trigger TextYankPost autocmd · vim/vim@fccbf06
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2057: getting the selection may trigger TextYankPost autocmd · vim/vim@fccbf06
attachments.text: Problem: Getting the selection may trigger TextYankPost autocmd. Solution: Only trigger the autocommand when yanking in Vim, not for getting the selection. (closes #7367)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/ce7be3a0e6f19bc85990bb8fcfe5e208944777b4|patch 8.2.2056: configure fails when building with implicit-function-…>
patch 8.2.2056: configure fails when building with implicit-function-declaration

Problem:    Configure fails when building with the
            "implicit-function-declaration" error enabled, specifically on Mac.
Solution:   Declear the functions like in the source code. (suggestion by
            Clemens Lang, closes #7380)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/2472a74be4dedfeaff22314f31cf9787618163d1|patch 8.2.2055: MS-Windows: two Vim instances may use the same temp file>
patch 8.2.2055: MS-Windows: two Vim instances may use the same temp file

Problem:    MS-Windows: two Vim instances may use the same temp file.
Solution:   Use the process ID for the temp name. (Ken Takata, closes #7378)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2055: MS-Windows: two Vim instances may use the same temp file · vim/vim@2472a74
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2055: MS-Windows: two Vim instances may use the same temp file · vim/vim@2472a74
attachments.text: Problem: MS-Windows: two Vim instances may use the same temp file. Solution: Use the process ID for the temp name. (Ken Takata, closes #7378)
